mdes.slick.sui
Class Label

java.lang.Object
  mdes.slick.sui.Component
      mdes.slick.sui.Container
          mdes.slick.sui.Label
Direct Known Subclasses:
Button, Frame.Resizer, Frame.TitleBar, SimpleColorPicker.ColorCursor, SimpleColorPicker.ColorPane, ToolTip
public class Label
extends Container

Label is the base class for displaying a String and/or Image on a component. Text is always drawn over images, which are drawn over the color background (if opaque).

Text and images can be aligned horizontally and/or vertically through setHorizontalAlignment and setVerticalAlignment.

All labels start with a padding of 0, initially centered.

Since:
b.0.1

Method Detail

updateAppearance

public void updateAppearance()
Description copied from class: Component

This method updates the appearance by retrieving it from the current skin.

This method is typically called from the constructor of a subclass. It is usually implemented in the following manner: 

public void updateAppearance() {
     setAppearance(Sui.getSkin().getXXXAppearance());
 }
Where getXXXAppearance represents the component appearance (such as getButtonAppearance).

Overrides:
updateAppearance in class Container

getYOffset

protected float getYOffset(java.lang.String s)
Gets the yoffset if the current font is an instanceof AngelCodeFont, otherwise returns 0. This method on its own does not change the protected variable yoffset. Whenever the text changes, this method is used to store the new offset in the yoffset variable.

Returns:
the yoffset of the font if it is an instanceof AngelCodeFont, otherwise 0
